text: Maria Ulrika Kalte, born 19 May 1970 in Skärholmen, Sweden is a Swedish former association football player. She played for Älvsjö AIK and the Swedish national team during the 1995 World Cup in Sweden, where Sweden was knocked out in the quarterfinal game. and the 1996 Olympic Tournament in Atlanta, where Sweden ended up 6th. She began playing for Norsborgs FF, before becoming professional in Japan. as she moved to Shiroki F.C. Serena after the 1995 World Cup.Fotbollextra 25 1995, 19 October 1995 == International career == In May 1989 Kalte made her national team debut at Wembley Stadium, as Sweden beat England 2–0 in a curtain raiser for the Rous Cup. Down 0-1 to China in the Quarter-Finals of the 1995 World Cup, Ulrika scored an equalizer in the 3rd minute of second half stoppage time to draw level and keep the hosts alive. Her team kept the match tied through extra time, but were eliminated from the tournament in a penalty kick shootout. == References == ==External links== Category:1970 births Category:Footballers at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Living people Category:Olympic footballers of Sweden Category:Shiroki FC Serena players Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Swedish expatriate footballers Category:Swedish footballers Category:Expatriate women's footballers in Japan Category:Swedish women's footballers Category:Sweden women's international footballers Category:1995 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:Swedish expatriate sportspeople in Japan Category:Sportspeople from Stockholm Category:Women's association football forwards Category:Sundbybergs IK players Category:Hammarby Fotboll (women) players Category:Älvsjö AIK players
title: Ulrika Kalte
